inn1.comm: cracking start for Watson, a full half volley and he leans into a power drive that beats a diving mid off...nothing like a sighter
ooh, here's an lbw shout from Bollinger, pitches in line and straightens, Kieswetter leaves and is struck on the thigh, that one is clearly too high
four more, a full ball on the stumps is punched straight down the ground past the out-stretched hand of Anderson and it races away
good comeback from Anderson, bends his back and gets some extra lift as Watson tries to cut but doesn't make contact
midwicket this time, Anderson too straight and Watson whips it through the leg side with a strong bottom hand...this pitch looks full of runs and there's also a fast outfield
back of a length outside off stump, Watson waits for it and angles the ball to third man to keep the strike
worked off the stumps through the on side, there's a big gap at square leg and fine leg has a long way to come around
same again from Watson, an almost identical shot and an identical outcome as it's place well enough for a brace...too straight from Bresnan
better line this time, outside off and it's chopped down towards backward point
comes onto the front foot and defends
worked out to midwicket and he can't find the gap...not much sign of any swing so far
that's a rubbish ball, fine leg had just been brought up so he drifts it into leg stump and is easily picked off for another boundary
on off stump, comes onto the front foot and defends towards mid off
he's away now, another wide drive ball from Anderson and Paine slots it comfortably through the covers
drags his length back a bit and defends down to mid off
on off stump, Paine drops it into the covers and thinks of a single but quickly decides there isn't one on offer
onto the back foot and pushed towards mid on
angled down to third man, it was quite close to the body for a cut shot but he played it very neatly
back of a length outside off, Paine opens the face and defends square on the off side
this is better stuff, hitting the pitch hard outside off, Paine defends into the covers
defended on the walk as Paine comes forward, but can't find a gap in the off side
well bowled, first hint of movement we've seen as this scoots past the outside edge although Paine did suggest he withdrew the bat - not sure he actually did
that's dismissive, steps down the pitch and to the leg then frees his arm to launch this high over mid off...bounces twice before crossing the boundary at long off
good comeback from Bresnan, Paine is squared up and a leading edge doesn't quite carry to cover
full on off stump, a very correct forward defensive with bat and pad together
onto the front foot again, driven firmly down to mid on
pushed into the leg side off a thick inside half of the bat and midwicket makes a good save
width and flashed off a top edge through the now vacant slip area down to third man...Strauss fiddling with his field
driven firmly into the ground and it bounces up to backward point
beats the outside edge as Watson goes for another booming drive but doesn't quite get to the pitch
driven in the air but it falls short of backward point where Eoin Morgan, the man of the moment, now finds himself
no width on this one, defended back to the bowler
worked into the covers and this time he finds the gap for a single
another edge as Watson drives, it flies in the air but would have needed a fourth slip to take that catch
on off stump, defended back towards the bowler in his follow through
dropped into the off side and Paine sets off straight away for a single but Bresnan is quickly onto the ball and the batsman wouldn't have had a chance
starts on middle and off, Watson onto the front foot and defends back to the bowler
waits on the back foot and opens the face down to third man
back of a length at Paine's body, takes the inside edge and bobbles down by his feet
picks out backward point as he opens the face
that's a lovely shot, it wasn't a half volley but Paine leaned into an elegant square drive that raced over a quick outfield
this one isn't as full and Paine defends into the off side
onto the front foot and again tries to open the face...backward point, as usual, is being kept busy
just goes a little too straight, giving Watson the chance to flick this through the leg side towards deep square-leg
corrects the line back to off stump, Watson onto the front foot and defends to cover
pushed square on the off side and can't find a gap in the cover ring
this time Watson is able to glide the ball down to third man
that's a wild mow from Paine...he stepped outside leg stump and almost swung himself off his feet without getting anywhere near the ball
whipped off middle and off, sweetly timed but straight to Anderson at mid on who is deep enough to allow the single
stays back in the crease, opens the face and picks out third man
on middle and Watson defends in a crouched style towards short midwicket
outside off, pushed into the covers...Broad is looking in decent rhythm here
flashes and misses outside off, some extra bounce on that one but Watson will feel he had four on offer
worked off middle and leg and he picks out about the only part of the ground where a three is possible as Michael Yardy scampers around from deep square
back of a length, angling into Watson who defends off the back foot into the off side
defended down to mid on
enough width on this one to allow Watson the time to find a gap wide of backward point
ouch! Extra bounce from a good length and strikes Paine a nasty blow on a finger of the bottom hand. That happened at The Rose Bowl, too, and Paine is in pain (sorry)
he takes his hand off the bat this time as he defends, Bresnan banging the ball in back of a length to test out the hand again
works down to third man so he'll keep the strike at the end of the Powerplay
worked into the leg side and can't beat midwicket
Paine is looking a little rattled as he steps to leg again and tries to carve this through the off side without making contact

gone! That's a strangle down the leg side as Paine gets an edge trying to work the ball away and a simple catch to Kieswetter to give Broad his 100th ODI wicket...a timely breakthrough for England, just as Broad managed two days ago
finds Ponting's inside edge straight away, the ball goes away safely to fine leg
there he goes again, opening the face down to third man
nice drive but not quite timed, he took a big stride into the shot and found the gap between cover and backward point
keeps Ponting on the back foot and he defends into the covers
outside off and angling in, Ponting judges well and leaves alone
that's a beauty, this one goes the other and Ponting is beaten as he lunges forward
lovely shot, dragged down on leg stump and Ponting flicks it away effortlessly perfectly bisecting deep square and long leg
more extra bounce from Bresnan and this time Ponting is the one in the firing line as he plays quite low, gets squared up and looks rather ungainly
punched off middle stump, straight down the ground but mid on is now quite straight and cuts it off
ooh, that was close and it's almost another pull that does for Ponting but the ball just evades one of the two midwickets in place
full on middle and off, Ponting defends on the walk back to the bowler
punched off the back foot into the covers
banged in outside off, Ponting jumps into a defensive shot
this time Ponting uses the release shot down to third man
starts well here, on off stump and Ponting defends square on the off side
width outside off but punched straight to cover
good line, back of a length on off stump and Ponting is in defence again
pitched up slower ball this time, Ponting comes onto the front foot and has to be careful not to play too early
on off stump, defended into the off side
finds the gap this time with a neat push off the back foot between cover and mid off...still, a good opening over from Wright
touch of width outside off but Watson picks out cover with a back-foot drive
opens the face and gets a single to third man
outside off, pushed firmly to backward point

gone! Broad strikes again and it's the big wicket of Ponting. Back of a length from Broad and the Australia captain pushed forward outside off, getting a thick edge which carries at chest height to Kieswetter
starts with a bouncer which loops through over off stump as Clarke sways out of the line
pushed off the back foot to cover
on a length and accurate, Watson comes forward to defend
a touch shorter on off stump, Watson gets back and across and punches firmly to mid off on the back foot
crunch! Was that a slower cutter? Indeed it was, and Watson picked it early to flick it powerfully over midwicket. He's looked good today, and that was another top shot
full and straight, Watson pushes the ball to mid on
interesting shot, a sort of front-foot pull on bended knee to a seam-up delivery from Wright. He got enough on it to paddle to the fine leg boundary
back of a length, Watson pushes his weight back and taps it back to the bowler
feisty delivery! Not a bouncer, but it got up to neck height as Clarke defended it down in front of his face

close! Another short ball from Broad, and it hurried on to Clarke as he shaped to pull. He was in no position for the shot when the ball arrived, and top-edged towards fine leg. Luckily for him, it fell safely, but he wasn't at all in control there
fuller, and just outside off. Watson opens the face of the blade to run it to third man
back of a length, Clarke rises up and drops the ball under his nose
back of a length again, safely defended to the on side

gone! The change works, another short ball from Broad, Clarke was up on his toes but couldn't control it, the ball balloons off the glove straight to Swann! He was put in an awkward position and the bottom hand came off the bat, easy catch to short leg
pushed firmly to cover
guiding down to third man this time, he's played that shot a lot today and picked up plenty of singles down there
on the back foot and tapped back down the wicket
and again, solid defence back down the wicket
off the mark with a nudge to fine leg
fuller this time, and straight. Watson plays the safety shot, playing with the full face down to long on

back of a length, outside off, and Watto goes to fifty with yet another guide down to third man. He's played so well today, and his team need him to stick around for a while longer and play a big innings now
similar ball, White plays it down to the same fielder but in his own style, standing up tall and playing it with a vertical, angled bat.
slower ball, just running his fingers over it. Watson keeps his eye on the ball and tucks carefully to midwicket
nice cricket shot. Broad strays onto leg stump and Watson moves nicely across and plays a perfect leg glance down to the fine leg boundary.
outside off this time, on a good length and Watson pushes the ball back to Broad
bouncer! That was quick and well-directed, but Watto has his eye in and just drops to his knees and lets the ball sail over him in good time. The crowd liked that one...
attempted bouncer from Wright, but it didn't get up and White stood up tall and played a controlled pull to deep square
back of a length on off stump, pushed back to Wright off the back foot
a touch straight, pushed down to long on

edged! Great delivery, but he's over-stepped! A touch of movement on a ball right in the channel outside off, White pushed at it with no great certainty and Kieswetter leapt to his right to pull off a sharp catch. Not that it matters, Free hit coming up!
White goes for an almighty heave to leg as Wright digs one in halfway down. The ball takes the toe edge and goes towards gully and they take a quick single
full and straight, and Watson is quickly into a textbook forward defensive ... which he times well enough to pick up a single to long on. That was all defensive, he just timed it so well!
back of a length, pushed back to the bowler
tapped down to long on for a single
pitching middle and off from round the wicket, defended
full and straight again, tapped gently to cover
watchful stuff from White so far, pushing back down the wicket
same again, accurate bowling and watchful defensive batting
slightly shorter and a hint of width too, White goes back to slash to gully, but no great harm done - just a single
bouncer, and hooked down to fine leg. He rolled his wrists on the ball, though, and so kept it down
nagging line and length, on off stump and Watson presses forward in defence

gone! The short ball works again! Watson had played so well until this shot - he went for an ungainly front-foot pull when he should have been back, the top edge rockets straight up, Kieswetter calls for it and takes a good, sliding catch. Australia pegged back once again, and after such a good start they're looking decidedly vulnerable now
short and wide outside off, White hammers this one straight to cover who stops it cleanly. Helped by the friendly bounce
just shaping away a little, White hangs on the back foot and defends
good length, and straight too. White pushes defensively to mid on
accurate start, pitching just outside off and Hussey pushes to gully
defended solidly back to the bowler
just a little too straight, Hussey shuffles onto the back foot and across to off stump in a flash and nudges the ball behind square on the leg side to get off the mark
pushed to long off for a single. Cover dives but can't quite cut it off, and they amble through
full and straight, Hussey flicks nicely to leg but midwicket leaps to his right to cut it off
worked through square on the leg side, Hussey is looking busy and focussed at the crease already
nice shot, neatly driven through cover and Hussey has his first boundary. The ball was there to be hit, really - a half-volley dished up wide of off, and he nailed it through cover
much better line this time, just outside off on a length and Hussey pulls his bat out the way and watches it go by
same again, slightly wider this time but in the channel outside off and Hussey watches the ball go by
closer to the stumps now, and Hussey aims a fidgety defensive shot into the off side
straighter still, Hussey shapes to tuck to leg but can't quite get it away, the ball rolling back down towards Wright
punched firmly off the back foot to cover, who stops cleanly
pushed defensively towards midwicket

inventive! White positions himself for the scoop over the keeper and pulls it off nicely to send the ball to the fine leg boundary. Good shot to play with the pace on the ball with Yardy darting them in
tapped back to the bowler
slipping just down leg this time, White sweeps the ball firmly down to fine leg, but the fielder was moved after the paddle-scoop earlier and so it's cut off
solid-looking defensive stroke
Hussey pushes his weight back and plays a wristy back-foot punch through cover
loosener to start, no great pace and he's slipped down leg to Hussey - rightly called wide
that's better, landing middle and off from over the wicket and Hussey hurries into a defensive stroke with his weight forward
speared slightly towards leg stump this time, Hussey shuffles across and flicks to pick up one to midwicket
dug in by Anderson, but the ball never really got up and White was in no trouble in angling it down to third man
sharp delivery! The last one didn't bounce much but this one leapt up off a length to strike Hussey on the thigh pad
and again, good exhibition of quick bowling as Anderson gets this one to spit up into the glove. Played with soft hands, though, and the ball goes down towards that man at slip
slightly wide of off, and Hussey is quite happy to leave this one alone after taking a couple of blows to the body and hands
pushed to cover, and they sprint through
full, Hussey times a drive to cover, who pulls off a good diving stop - well, almost, as the ball rebounds off the hand and they steal a single
angled to short third man
tip-and-run from White, as he drops the ball towards point and is called through immediately for a single
that's kept low! Hussey went back to flick to leg and the ball shot through at shin height. He's done well to hit that
huge appeal as White goes for a slog-sweep and is struck on the thigh. That was ambitious though, hit well outside the line and hawkeye suggests that was missing off
back of a length, landing middle and off and angling across and Hussey taps to cover. Loud call of "no!" comes immediately
fuller this time, and driven hard but straight to cover
touch of width offered, Hussey angles down through gully
and he immediately picks up a single with a nudge to midwicket
tight line and length, and White defends to the off side off the back foot
a little straighter this time, and coming in off the seam as well. White pushes to leg, but straight to midwicket
landing just outside off and spinning away, delivered from round the wicket, and Hussey punches to cover
straighter this time, but Hussey makes room and angles him down to short third man to rotate the strike
White lunges forward and plays an uppish flick to midwicket. Dropping short of the fielder there, however
very full indeed, White aims to push down the ground but Swann scoots across to cut it off
sharp turn in to the right hander, White nudges defensively to midwicket
good finish, pitching just outside off and spinning in and White defends

gone! Full and Anderson finds a hint of swing back in to the left-hander to beat an airy flick to leg and clatter into the stumps! Was that swing? He sent down a cross-seam delivery but the ball definitely jagged in to Hussey after pitching. Either way, he's gone and Australia are tottering now...
hmm, nervous start as Anderson pushes one down back of a length and Smith stays leg side - backing away a touch - and pushes defensively to cover
bouncer! Smith ducked under it in good time... slight fumble from Kieswetter in the take, but he recovers quickly to negate any thoughts of a single
extravagant leave from Smith, and it's well-judged - the ball nipping in a touch but missing the stumps by a good few inches
solidly defended towards mid-on. He seems to be settling now
venomous! Anderson gets one to leap off a length and Smith pulls his bottom hand off the bat as he defends.  Struck on the glove though
worked off the stumps to backward square
round the wicket, flat outside off, left alone
on off stump, turned out to midwicket
dragged down short outside off, but the cut isn't timed and goes straight to cover
swept from leg stump out to deep square
stays on the back foot and chops out to the cover sweeper
well bowled, full on middle and off, takes the outside edge down to third man
good line outside off, left alone
top shot, Anderson went full on middle stump and Smith met it with a full face to drive perfectly down the ground
dropped into the covers and they scamper a quick one
tight on off stump, White comes half forward and defends with bat and pad together
rocks onto the back foot and drives out to deep cover
fired in at leg stump, White pushes with a straight bat and beats the diving midwicket
turned off the stumps through square leg
dragged down on leg stump and Yardy gets away with it as White bottom edges to short fine-leg
driven in the air but falls of short midwicket
fetches this from outside off, swept hard through square leg and Swann makes a complete hash of the stop on the boundary
defended back to the bowler
cut away from off stump, Broad uses all his height to make a good save at backward point
whipped from outside off down to long on
pushed back to the bowler as tries to turn to leg
take that...White's had enough of prodding and poking, so instead swings this high over long on off one knee
back to defence, into the off side
blocked into the leg side and midwicket prevents a single
on middle, defended down the on side
that's a good leave...delivered from quite wide and it angled back at Smith who shoulders arms, with the ball passing close to off stump
flicked off leg stump out to deep square
short and pushed down the leg side, White swivels on a pull down to long leg
short again and helped out to deep square-leg
short and wide, White stays on the back foot and hammers it square through the off side with enough power to beat deep cover
another boundary, this time from Smith, as he sweeps hard from outside off and beats deep square
defended into the on side
goes back into his crease and tucks this out to deep square
another strong sweep as White clubs this along the ground into the deep
tossed up outside off, driven out to the cover sweeper
digs out a yorker back to the bowler
on middle and defended back to Bresnan in his follow through
back of a length and tucked out to midwicket
full outside off, met with a wild swing across the line from Smith and he was never in a shape to make contact with that
much more controlled, angled away with an open face to third man
behind the line and defends to the on side
good stuff from Bresnan, tight on off stump and White defends again
full on off stump, dropped square on the off side for a well-judged single
same place in the off side, same result for White this time
drifts onto leg stump, tucked neatly off his legs out to deep square
on off stump, Wright fields in his follow through
on leg stump, worked through midwicket and good work in the deep keeps them to a single
another wild heave across the line from Smith...he's better than that, and surprisingly doesn't make contact and is lucky not to be bowled
round the wicket with his low arm action, angled to leg stump, pushed down to long on
flat outside off, pushed into the off side
tries to sweep from outside off and gets a bottom edge into his pads
can't beat the man at midwicket as he works off his pads
leans back and drives through the covers to the sweeper
driven into the off side and can't beat cover
tucked out to deep square
a rare boundary...White connects well against a sharp bouncer, pulled in the air for a while but he picked the gap between deep square and fine leg
back of a length, White nearly forces a return catch as he drives a touch early and his bottom hand comes off the bat
punched back down the pitch again where Wright makes a good save in his follow through
tries to open up through the off side, but it skews off a thick outside edge and flies square over point
flipped straight to midwicket
Smith backs way to leg and tries to run the ball down to third man, but finds gully
driven hard down to long on
aggressive drive through cover from White, the sweeper sprints round to cut it off
full, wide and driven backward of square on the off side by Smith, again sweeper runs round - in the other direction this time - to cut it off. He must be pooped!
low full toss on middle and leg, punched hard back to the bowler
a touch short, but quick and straight and White is content to push it down to long off for one
that's nipped in a touch off the seam, White had shaped to punch through cover but instead picks up a single on the leg side as an inside edge trickles to midwicket
angling in to the hips, tucked to fine leg
nice length, drawing him forward but not quite there to drive. He pushes the ball to cover
crunch! He slaps a slightly shorter ball very firmly off the back foot to cover, but straight to the fielder
fuller and straighter, White pushes him down to long on to rotate the strike
back of a length, angling in, and tucked to midwicket for one
a touch short, slashed away behind square on the off side
pushed to long off, and White has the strike again
this keeps low! But White is solidly behind it in defence
and that'll be fifty for White, slapped away square on the off side and out to the cover sweeper
low full toss, driven out to boundary rider on the off side
angling in to the pad, White tries to flick to leg but can't get anything on it
short ball on off stump and Smith hacks it out to cover. He was aiming leg side but ended up swiping to off as he backed away
slower-ball bouncer, and pulled out to deep square
short, wide and White tried to uppercut over short third man - there's no-one on the boundary there - but he can't get a connection. He's annoyed by that...
short again and slapped up and over cover point! Nice shot, he was in an awkward position but that was hit really hard
again he backs away to leg, but Broad follows him this time with a full, straight ball which is wristily pushed down to long on
just over the top of middle! Smith gave himself acres of room, Broad sent down a slower cutter on a length and the ball beat the bat, looping just over the stumps

drama! Anderson fires in a yorker, White jammed his bat down and the ball went nowhere but Smith had charged down for the single. As he turns to get back he runs into Anderson, who was trying to get to the ball, and they briefly engage in a flurry of arms and legs. All good natured stuff, of course
very full again, flicked out square on the leg side
low full toss, and Smith is audibly annoyed at having missed out on that as he clips softly to square leg
backs away to leg and drives to long off

shot! Shades of Tatenda Taibu there, Smith backs metres away to leg, Anderson fires one full and wide outside off and Smith flays him over point from a kneeling position. Good shot in the end, four runs!
slapped to point, and a misfield allows them to pick up three
quick, on a length and outside off. Smith aims to carve him through point but doesn't connect
a flat-batted hack to a shortish ball on middle runs wide of mid on and they scramble through

chance for a run out! Broad sent down a slower cutter, which White tapped back down the wicket. The batsmen set off straight away, Broad leapt across the wicket and gathered the ball but his back-handed throw missed the stumps with White well short
huge swipe to leg, but he's missed it completely and the ball flies over the top of middle

gone this time! Well, it was an energetic innings from Smith, but he's played too early at this one as he tried to pick the ball up over the leg side. The ball took the leading edge and looped up quite high but not very far, and Collingwood at cover takes an easy catch
dropped just behind point for a quick single
pinpoint yorker from Anderson, White has a big swing but the ball rolls easily back to the bowler
very full again, low full toss this time, and pushed down to long on
ooh, doesn't quite find the yorker length this time. The ball slips out as a half-volley and Hopes hammers it through the covers for four
that's more like it. Yorker right in the blockhole and Hopes can't do any better than keep it away from his stumps
slower-ball bouncer, hoicked out to deep midwicket
full and driven to deep mid off, White keeps strike
sharp bouncer! White backed to leg and Broad followed him with a short one. He went through with the hook though he was in no position to do so, but the ball zips past him
on the hips, tucked to midwicket and just a single
back of a length and quick, he pulls mightily but doesn't quite get the connection he was after, the ball goes to midwicket
and he duly taps the ball out to that fielder, and very sharp running get's them two

double bluff from White, but it didn't help him! He backed to leg, and then shuffled way over to the off side as Broad gathered, but the ball came down on a length just outside off and he couldn't get a touch on it
backs away and Broad follows him with a full ball, pushed softly to square leg and they charge through
swiped to wide long on, just the single
very low full toss punched to wide long on again, again not wide enough of that man for them to scamper back for two
driven down to long on, great stuff from Anderson, very disciplined
Hopes charges down the track and smashes the ball over cover. Good shot, but there's a man out there to cut it off so just the one
very high full toss, almost waist height, and White isn't going to miss out on that! He smashes it, baseball-style, high over cow corner for six! Australia need a few more of those...
much better, full and straight and just a single taken as the ball goes to short fine leg
smashed high, very high over cover, Collingwood charges back as long off comes round, but neither of them can get to it and the ball plugs into safely into the turf
thumped straight back over Bresnan's head, one bounce and into the boundary boards!
Bresnan digs one in short and White hammers a pull out behind square on the leg side! That's going to prompt another change in the field, Bresnan isn't happy with this bowling plan
very short indeed, this loops way over White and down the leg side too. That wasn't pretty, and immediately called wide
he does, and the ball is crashed down to that man at long off

full, straight Hopes hammers it back to the bowler and they go for the run though the ball went straight back to Bresnan and he held it cleanly. Hopes is run out, really he sacrificed himself to get White on strike for the last delivery
good yorker, White digs it out and they charge through regardless. Bresnan picks the ball up in his follow through but White beats him to the other end, so a single off the last ball

inn2.comm: legside to start with and there's a single clipped through midwicket
ooh, here's an  lbw shout, pitching in line and straightening, Kieswetter leaves and is struck on the thigh but that one is going well over the top
oops, Bollinger has sprayed this one well wide of off
thick inside edge onto the pad
yuck, another horrible squirty full toss that flies a long way wide of off
a thick inside edge now, Kieswetter gets it away to fine leg, a bit lucky there
another edge and another boundary! Bollinger angles it across the right-hander, there's no swing and there's no third slip, so that flies away to third man
left alone outside off, no swing for Bollinger
a half-volley to start with, Strauss drives to mid-off, and he gets a free hit as McKay has got his run-up wrong there
and Strauss makes good use of the free hit, a juicy half-volley and the England captain frees his arms and launches it high over long-on for six
Strauss defends, but it's another overstep from McKay
another free hit is used well by Strauss, it's a full toss and Strauss slaps it over wide mid-off for four
angled across Strauss, who leaves it alone
defended towards cover
no swing for McKay, and Strauss defends again
straighter this time and Strauss clips to midwicket
left alone outside off
gone! Bollinger strikes as Kieswetter comes down the pitch and gets a clunky bottom edge through to Paine, the ball barely carries but the keeper makes the take
clipped away to square leg
good ball, a sharp bouncer and well directed, Pietersen does very well to sway out of the way of that one
driven to mid off where Hopes does the fielding
worked to midwicket and that's good, sharp running as Pietersen beats Hussey's direct hit at the non-striker's end
driven through cover, Ponting does the chasing and Pietersen picks up three
leg side rubbish, and Strauss has no problem flicking it off his pads through square leg for four
better line and length, Strauss leaves it outside off
angled across Strauss again, he leaves it alone
this time Strauss tries for the drive, but can't beat mid off
straighter line, Strauss works it to point
driven to cover and they get through for a single
Strauss works it to midwicket and can't beat the field
that's a good yorker, straight and fast, but Strauss is equal to the task and whips it away to square leg
pushed to point
that one keeps a bit low, Pietersen gets a thick inside edge onto his pad
angled across Pietersen, who drives to cover
a bit too wide of off, Strauss cuts it away to third man
on the pads, Strauss glances behind square
another half-volley, Strauss drives to mid-off
straighter on off this time, Strauss nudges to midwicket and takes off for a quick single
Pietersen likes what he's seen of McKay, walks down the pitch and tries to crunch him through leg but straight to the man at midwicket
driven to mid off
and Strauss clears the boundary for the second time today! He gets a bouncer, goes for the hook and his top edge sails comfortably over the keeper's head
a good comeback from Bollinger, sharp bounce surprises Strauss, who drops the bottom hand off the handle as it clips him on the gloves
Pietersen nudges back to the bowler
angled across Pietersen, who defends
well played, Pietersen is on the back foot and drives wide of point, it bounces too high for the fielder to stop it
driven back to Bollinger
wide of off, Strauss cuts to third man
a thickish edge to point this time
defended back towards the bowler
left alone outside off
that has been positively murdered through midwicket! Short, without much speed and Pietersen creams a pull away to the boundary
defended back down the pitch
on the hips, Strauss clips to short fine leg
again Strauss works it to short fine leg, but this time just wide enough to allow him to get a single
crunched through cover for four. Too easy for Pietersen, wide of off and no pace, it was a simple matter of placement
clipped to midwicket and can't beat the field
good ball, this one jags back in from outside off and surprises Pietersen, but he's still good enough to drop it at his feet
a wristy flick to midwicket
worked to mid-on, Strauss gets a single
there's an lbw appeal in hope more than anything, it's angled a long way down leg and Pietersen gets a leg bye
Strauss punches this one forward of point, can't beat the field
Strauss walks down the pitch and prods to cover
looks for the pull from outside off here, but it doesn't connect and sails through to Paine
nice shot, Strauss goes for a cover drive and beats the man diving inside the circle
on a length outside off, Pietersen sways back and slaps the ball through cover point
straight-ish, pitching middle and leg, and Strauss shuffles quickly across to nudge a single to square leg
this one jagged in after pitching - looked to be a slower offcutter - but the line isn't quite right and Pietersen works him through midwicket
angled down to third man, and he's hit it quite fine so they have time they sprint back for a second
good line, pitching just outside off and heading for middle and off, and Strauss pushes the ball back to Hopes
Strauss drops the ball close in on the off side and they sneak a single to end the over
just a fraction too short, and Strauss chops the ball down through the covers
with cover point out and no-one square of the wicket on the off side, this is easy runs. Pietersen just hangs back in the crease and pushes the ball square, easy single
just that little bit too short again, Strauss stays deep in the crease and whips the ball out to deep midwicket to pick up two and bring up the fifty partnership
much better, floated up fuller and Strauss lunges forward to defend
with mid on and mid off up, Strauss charges down the track but can't quite get to the pitch, pushing back down the wicket
good finish, Hauritz fired in the arm ball and Strauss just about picked it - late, but he had enough time to get the bat down to defend
tight line to start, on off stump and giving KP nothing. Batsman punches the ball back down the wicket
Pietersen walks down the wicket as Hopes digs one in short. The ball is met with a ferocious swing of the bat as a pull rockets out to deep midwicket
good line to the left-hander from round the wicket, tapped defensively to the on side
Strauss tries to run this one down to third man, but finds gully and the run is quickly turned down
just a hint of width given, and Strauss punches through cover off the back foot
whipped away, wide of the fielder at deep square leg and they get back for what is ultimately an easy two
angling in from round the wicket, and going straight on with the arm. Strauss rocks back and nudges to midwicket
full, straight, and driven down to long-on with ease.
good ball! Flighted just outside off and Strauss didn't quite read the length, defending off the back foot when he should have been forward
too straight from round the wicket, and Strauss nudges him square on the leg side with the angle
not the most dangerous ball, pitching off and turning in, but Pietersen lunges down the wicket to defend
reverse-swept! That wasn't the switch hit, a more orthodox reverse-sweep, if one can call it that. He didn't quite get hold of it, though he hit it well, and the ball pulls up short of the rope
short, wide long-hop first up, a real loosener, and Pietersen cracks him away to the boundary sweeper on the off side
pitching middle and turning in, worked to fine leg
very full, nicely flighted, but with a defensive field KP picks up an easy one to long-off
pushed into space in the covers and they take a tight single
nicely flighted, perhaps drifting too leg side and Pietersen swings him away against the spin to the wide midwicket boundary

what a catch! Pietersen came down the track and tried to hammer Smith away to midwicket again, but in the air this time. Ponting was in position close at midwicket but that looked to have cleared him ... until he leapt to pluck it out of the air one-handed. I think he even surprised himself with that one. Rolling back the years, Punter!
flicked past fine leg, they hurry back for the second run and Paine whips the bails off. Aleem Dar asks for the third umpire, but he was well in - direct hit would've been interesting though
nudged away square on the leg side to bring Collingwood on strike - he needs some time in the middle
that's the line! Hauritz floats it up outside off, finding drift away from the right-hander and some turn in to him. Brigadier block does what he does best
too wide this time, chopped down to gully

edged! Nicely flighted again, Strauss tried to whip the ball through midwicket but the ball turned to take the edge. It flew well wide of slip, however, and grounded very quickly - and that's fifty for the England captain
pushed into the on side
punched firmly back to the bowler, who threatens to throw the stumps down
there's some turn! The ball was speared in, but gripped and turned to take the outer half of the bat. Played with soft hands, though, so straight down
pushed to mid on
Collingwood gives himself some room and chops the ball, but inside edge and straight into the ground
awkward looking defence as Smith flights one on middle and off, but kept out
too short, too wide, and hammered out to the cover sweeper
drift again for Hauritz, and this one just seemed to go on with the drift rather than turn in. It took the outer edge of the bat and went down to third man
pushed softly to cover
Strauss is deep in the crease and going harder at the ball this time, but straight to the cover fielder again
worked out to midwicket for one
nice line, well wide of off - attacking - but Colly stretches out to smother the ball and they sneak a single as it rolls out to cover
flicked to the on side
ooh, that's very friendly to the new batsman. Nice full toss on his legs, Colly nurdles it with gusto to pick up a boundary at deep midwicket
much better, flighting it on middle and off, the ball spins away a touch and Colly defends
and again, tight line and Collingwood can only defend - unless he wants to take a risk
nope, floated on middle and off again and Collingwood lunges forward to defend
slightly shorter this time, Collingwood aims a slashed cut but finds point
that will be runs this time, too short again and Collingwood sends the ball out to the cover sweeper off the back foot
Hauritz is beginning to find his rhythm now. Nicely flighted outside off, bit of drift, and turning in to be met with a defensive bat
off the edge! There was drift and turn again, and the ball squirts off the edge but down to short third man - well wide of slip

gone! Strauss shimmies down the track, not quite getting to the pitch but trying to send the ball to long on. Instead, he pops the simplest of caught-and-bowled chances back to Hauritz, who gratefully accepts. Australia are cock-a-hoop, they need to keep chipping away at England!
cheeky paddle sweep to get off the mark! Well-played though, got into position early and kept his eyes on the ball to send it down fine on the leg side
slashed in the air! But short of gully, who runs round and collects it on the bounce. That was decidedly uppish...
off the inside edge this time, great bowling from Hauritz, who is pushing the ball out nice and wide. Colly goes to drive but the ball takes the inside edge and goes to fine leg
wide and very short to start - not enough to be called a wide, but inviting a shot outside off. Morgan declines, leaving alone and just having a look
jagging in off the seam this time, Morgan hops back to defend to the on side

short and wide again! This time Morgan tries to uppercut it, but can't get anything on it. Bollinger is fortunate to get away with that one, it looked way over head height. Umpire Aleem Dar signals one for the over...
beaten on the inside edge! The ball was much fuller this time and Morgan went to drive, but was beaten by a hint of seam movement and the ball shot between bat and pad
defended back down the wicket, but he didn't look all that comfortable in playing the shot. Still, kept out, which is the main thing
nice tight line to finish, on off stump and Morgan punches it back to the bowler, who collects in his follow-through
tossed up temptingly outside off, but Colly defends back down the wicket
defended again, tight so far from Hauritz.
just a little too short, Collingwood sends the ball behind gully and picks up a single
and point is in play straight away, as Morgan slaps the ball down off the back foot
well bowled! Tossed up really high by Hauritz, this one really gripped and spun past the outside edge of a defensive prod. He's beaten him by a good few inches there, it's spun too much!
this one goes on with the arm from round the wicket, but Morgan is equal to it and defends
hooked! They had men out for the shot, but Collingwood went right through with the shot, fetching the ball from infront of his nose and lifting it over the boundary. Six runs!
better length - hitting top of off - and good line too. Collingwood gets behind it and pushes back to the bowler
he's done the hard work for this over already, and now he can just settle in - which he does, defending a length ball just outside off to the covers
off the inside edge! This was much fuller and Colly aimed a bottom-handed drive to off, but the ball took the edge. Whoops, he's over-stepped too, so here comes a Free Hit!
that's intelligent bowling - Bollinger digs one in short and sends it whizzing past Morgan's grille. He tried to uppercut, but couldn't get a touch on it
ooh, Morgy's been hit in the midriff now. Bollinger gets one to come in off the seam, pitching on a length, and Morgan's defensive tuck to midwicket is beaten... ouch.
good finish to the over, Morgan taps the ball defensively back to the bowler
nice drift from Hauritz, but pitching too straight and Collingwood has no trouble pushing him easily down to long-on

come on Morgan, you're better than that! He comes down the wicket and aims an ugly smear to the leg side. He didn't quite get to the pitch but went through with the shot, and the ball rolled to the leg side. Not a good-looking shot by any means
pushed to midwicket in a much more-orthodox manner. Better, risk-free stroke
chopped down behind square on the off side
spin! That pitched on off stump and turned away sharply. Morgan wasn't beaten this time, though, he pulled the bat well inside the line
speared down the leg side from round the wicket, and that'll be a wide
single to finish the over, as Morgan pushes a full  ball on off stump into the covers
full and quite wide, Morgan gets forward and across, right over the ball, and works the ball through cover for a couple. "Sniff it," says Bumble on comms. "A lot of sniffage in that!"
better line, tight on off stump and Morgan defends
slashed to gully. There were runs to be had there, but he couldn't get it away
great fielding from Bollinger! Morgan punched the ball very firmly down the ground but the tall fast bowler ran across, tumbled over, and the ball stuck immediately in his right hand. Top effort!
on a length on off stump, Collingwood taps it back to the bowler
and ditto to finish, identical ball, identical shot.
pushed out through cover off the back foot, sweeper runs round to keep them to two
and again, hit straight to the fielder on the boundary this time, so just the one
beaten outside off! Collingwood tried to carve it away square off the back foot but the ball was too full, and not nearly wide enough for the shot.
wider this time, and now he gets runs. Pitching a good foot outside off and turning in, Collingwood chops down to third man
coming forward this time and angling the bat to try and send the ball behind square
swept! Not pretty, but mighty effective as he sends the ball down very fine on the leg side. Hopes charges after it and cuts it off. Good effort
driven back towards the bowler
on the back foot, Collingwood punches a drive to the man at deep cover
some intent from Morgan there as he walks across outside off and tries to flick through leg, but can't connect
width outside off, Morgan cuts to third man
on off stump, Morgan defends
cut away to deep point where Hussey does the fielding
a yorker of sorts there, Morgan digs it out
some sharp spin there, but unfortunately for Smith it's turning well down leg and Morgan clips it to fine leg
solid in defence from Collingwood
short outside off, Collingwood bunts it towards long off
drifting across the left-hander, who defends
and there's the reverse sweep! Smith pushes it a long way across off stump and Morgan swivels the hands around to whip it past the diving man at short third man, lovely shot
worked away through midwicket
defended away to the off side
cut to the man at point
driven straight back to Watson
angled in towards off stump, Morgan tucks it to mid on
shortish from Watson, Morgan swipes it over midwicket for a single
turns in towards off, Morgan backs away and cuts to deep cover
clipped off the pads through midwicket
drifting in to the pads, Collingwood clips to midwicket
this time he beats midwicket and they take two to the sweeper on the boundary
prodded to point
Collingwood advances this time, he's keen to go over the top but checks his shot
oh Clint, what are you doing? Just as with his first spell, he's started with a no-ball, this one driven through cover. So here comes yet another free hit
this time Morgan can't make best use of the free hit, it's a bouncer that he tries to hook and gets a bottom edge onto his pads
Collingwood defends to leg
oustide off, Collingwood swipes and can't connect
solid in defence
crunched away to cover
and with that hook of a slower ball to fine leg, Paul Collingwood has now become England's highest scorer in ODI history
pushed down to long off for an easy single
angled across Morgan, who defends
prodded back to the bowler
wider of off, Morgan swipes that one towards the deep cover
leading edge skied, is there a man there? No! Collingwood gets away with it, the ball landed well short of deep cover
clipped through leg
Collingwood is solid in defence again
flicked to midwicket, doesn't beat the field
good line outside off, Collingwood defends
driven to cover, Ponting does the fielding
driven back to the bowler
errr, no, he can't - Collingwood walks at McKay and picks the ball up sweetly to lift it high over midwicket for six
flicked to midwicket
there's a wrong'un from Smith, Morgan picks it and defends
walks across his stumps and dabs that one to fine leg
solid in defence
nicely played, Collingwood advances and lifts Smith over wide mid on for a boundary
driven to cover and can't beat Ponting
cut away behind point for a single
strays onto the pads of Collingwood, who doesn't get it away properly
Morgan works it to mid on, no run there
nice placement from Morgan, who guides it past cover and makes the man on the boundary do some running to keep it to two

what a good shot, a short ball outside off and Morgan has somehow worked a pull through midwicket, a ball on that line should not have ended up there. In the deep, Hopes makes an excellent diving save
Collingwood works it to leg
on the pads, but Morgan can't get him away

well, that's one way to do it! Just a little bit short, but Morgan was into position for the pull like lightning and absolutely thumped it away to wide midwicket. Short-arm jab really, he just timed it superbly
down the leg side again, and swept fine this time
pushed out to cover
short and wide again, slapped out to deep cover to rotate the strike
better finish to the over, much fuller and Morgan pushes the ball firmly back to the bowler
very full, pushed back down the wicket

gone! Just when I was saying that the batsmen had settled in and Australia were without a strike bowler, Bollinger charges in and hits the stumps! The ball was outside off and Collingwood went for a leaden-footed pushed to the off side, little inside edge and into the stumps. Still, he's probably done enough to close down the game
full to start, and Wright presses forward to defend
back of a length and rising, Wright rises with the ball and plays it down to gully
shortish length again, Wright couldn't quite keep this one under control, and an inside edge went down to his boot - that could've run back onto the stumps, but luckily for him it went wide
just outside off and angling across him, Wright is quite happy to leave alone
too short! In the form that he's in, Morgan has no trouble at all rocking back and pulling him in the air infront of square to the gap at midwicket. Too easy
very full this time, and flighted, Morgan works the ball to midwicket along the ground
punched off the back foot to cover
arm ball that went straight on, but he's erred in line and Wright is off the mark as he nudges the ball to leg
flicked down to fine leg, they hurry back for the second and that's fifty for Morgan!
nudged to leg for one to keep the strike
tip-and-run from Morgan, as he just drops the ball towards cover and they set off. Good understanding between these two in their running
driven on the up, he sliced at the ball a little as it angled across him and the shot went to backward point rather than through the covers
full, a long half-volley on off stump but Wright can only drive to mid-off
ooh, that's a spicy meatball from Bollinger! Back of a length and nibbling around off the seam, Wright is cramped for room and ends up playing a very awkward looking defensive stroke.
short, and sliced down to third man for one
good, tight finish to the over. Zoning in on off stump, and Morgan pushes the ball defensively towards point
smashed! Wright wanders down the wicket as Hopes drops one short outside off, and he just swings right through the line to send the ball flashing to the cover boundary

well, this shot is even better! Hopes went fuller, but again there was width on offer outside off and Wright aimed a textbook cover drive out to the boundary. There's a man out there, but it was hit so well he couldn't do anything about it
straighter line this time, Wright defends off the back foot

gone this time! Poor shot selection there, he had done the hard work with the two boundaries and was just looking to do too much with this ball. It was on a length and straight, coming in off the seam, and he tried to run it to third man though the ball was practically angling in to the hip. Inside edge was the result, and the ball ricochets onto the stumps
good start, just short of a length and coming in a touch. Bresnan taps the ball watchfully back to the bowler
good finish to what started out as a terrible over, as he pushes this one nicely full and straight and Bresnan defends, looking for the cheeky single but there was none to be had
looked like he rolled his fingers over this one, though the pace wasn't that far down. Morgan pushes the ball to mid-on

gone! Test match bowling does for Eoin Morgan, as Bollinger spears one down back of a length just around off stump. The ball rose quite sharply off a length, took the edge near the shoulder of the bat, and went through to Paine. Great piece of bowling, do Australia have a sniff of an unlikely series-levelling win now?
sharp delivery! Back of a length once again, and Swann just took his eyes off it and turned away as the ball shot past his shoulder. Through to Paine, but that wasn't too far away from the glove...
fuller this time, and Swann is much happier with that, driving out through cover to get off the mark
shapes to nudge to leg, the ball takes the inside edge and ricochets off the thigh pad, but falls safely
full, Bresnan drops the ball into the gap on the off side and they set off immediately. Bresnan off the mark
nice tight line, pushed to cover point
a little too straight, easily worked to wide long on for one
nice shot! Driven handsomely through cover as the fielder was brought in
and he follows that up with a drop-and-run single to cover, intelligent batting
same again from Bresnan, good rotation of the strike and England are edging towards the win
leading edge! But drops well short of any fielders. Swann played too early at the ball
very full, Bresnan stretches forward to drive but can't time the shot
shorter this time, Bresnan rocks back in a flash and pulls out to deep square. Good, hard running gets them two, and just 18 needed now
again Bollinger goes full, again Bresnan can't time the drive. His bottom hand is coming through too hard, he closes the bat face and the ball squirts to leg though he was aiming through the covers
now he times it! The ball wasn't as full as the other two, and it was wider and Bresnan thrashed him ... but straight to cover. And he's over-stepped! At a time like this!
crashed away! Short ball and Bresnan likes them there, hammering a pull in front of square and away to the boundary. England getting closer now!
pushed firmly into the covers, mid-off scoots round to cut it off so just a single
swung away bottom-handed towards midwicket
back of a length outside off, slapped out to deep cover off the back foot
nice running again, Australia just can't plug the gaps and another cheeky single

ooh, that looked nasty! Swann came down the track as McKay slipped one in short, and he wore it right on the side of the helmet. Horrible, clanging sound as it hit the helmet, but he's fine. Little edge on it as well, so given as runs
big swing outside off, Bresnan can't connect
good ball! Angling in and then holding it's line, Bresnan plays inside it and is beaten. Never got close to it, though
and beaten again, to finish the over! Fuller, and wider of off and Bresnan flings the bat at it but can't connect
beaten! The ball was a little short and Swann rocked back to cut, but was beaten by bounce and turn
goes down on bended knee to sweep this time, struck on the pad to elicit an appeal, but that was very ambitious... Struck well outside off
was that a wrong 'un? A flipper? Either way it seemed to rush straight on, striking Swann on the pad but going well over
swept out to deep square
pushed out on the off side off the back foot
punched to cover, but straight to the fielder
short and wide, cut away behind square and Bollinger sprints round from third man to cut it off

what a shot! It's all over now, and in style! McKay dished up a half-volley on off stump and Swann just murdered it over long-off. The ball never got up high but went way over the rope, and Swann is pumping his fist! The crowd had been very vocal as England closed in on the win, and they're cheering now too.
